requests.name: AntiVirusDatVer
requests.description:
Purpose: This is called to update the AV DAT version for a build record ID’s BOM.

Returns

•	HTTP 400 - if syntax error in JSON or JSON missing

•	HTTP 400 - if BOM record can't be found for the given build record ID

•	HTTP 400 - if BOM record is locked

•	HTTP 500 - if a server error occurs

•	HTTP 200 - if the record was added successfully

requests.name: Bom (GET)
requests.description:
Purpose: This returns a JSON representation of a BOM record.

Notes

TODO: Add Solution/Product/Component details to JSON. Currently all we have is the Build Record ID.

requests.name: CodeExport
requests.description:
Purpose: This is used to add the code export details for a BOM record. It can be called multiple times for any Build Record ID.

Returns

•	HTTP 400 - if syntax error in JSON or JSON missing

•	HTTP 400 - if a BOM record doesn't exist for the Build Record Id passed

•	HTTP 400 - if the BOM is locked for the Build Record Id passed

•	HTTP 500 - if a server error occurs

•	HTTP 200 - if the record was added successfully

requests.name: BuildDependencyTable
requests.description: Purpose: This returns the JSON used to generate the build dependency table on the client.

requests.name: OrbitDependency
requests.description:
Purpose: This is used to add a record of an Orbit dependency, tied to a Build Record ID.

Returns

•	HTTP 400 - if syntax error in JSON or JSON missing

•	HTTP 400 - if a BOM record doesn't exist for the Build Record Id passed

•	HTTP 400 - if the BOM is locked for the Build Record Id passed

•	HTTP 500 - if a server error occurs

•	HTTP 200 - if the record was added successfully

requests.name: EcmMockMasterRecord
requests.description:
Purpose: This is used to add a reference to the ECM Master Record ID of the mocked record in ECM for this Orbit build. It updates the existing BOM with the given build record ID with this information.

Returns

•	HTTP 400 - if syntax error in JSON or JSON missing

•	HTTP 400 - if a BOM record doesn't exist for the Build Record Id passed

•	HTTP 400 - if the BOM is locked for the Build Record Id passed

•	HTTP 500 - if a server error occurs

•	HTTP 200 - if the record was updated successfully

requests.name: EcmDependency
requests.description:
Purpose: This is used to add a record of an ECM dependency, tied to a Build Record ID.

Returns

•	HTTP 400 - if syntax error in JSON or JSON missing

•	HTTP 400 - if a BOM record doesn't exist for the Build Record Id passed

•	HTTP 400 - if the BOM is locked for the Build Record Id passed

•	HTTP 500 - if a server error occurs

•	HTTP 200 - if the record was added successfully

requests.name: LockBom
requests.description:
Purpose: This locks a BOM record from any further modifications, including adding of code exports and dependencies. There is no way to undo this via the API, although it can be manually reset via the database.

Returns

•	HTTP 400 - if a BOM record doesn't exist for the Build Record Id passed

•	HTTP 400 - if the BOM is already locked

•	HTTP 500 - if a server error occurs

•	HTTP 200 - if the record was added successfully

requests.name: Bom (POST)
requests.description:
Purpose: This function is used to add the initial details of a BOM record to the CMDB. It must be called to create that initial record before any other API calls are made.

Returns

•	HTTP 400 - if syntax error in JSON or JSON missing

•	HTTP 400 - if BOM record already exists for the specified
build record ID

•	HTTP 500 - if a server error occurs

•	HTTP 200 - if the record was added successfully

Notes

•	This can only be called once for any Build Record ID

requests.name: Agent
requests.description:
Purpose: This is used to associate build agents with a BOM. It can be called multiple times.

Returns

•	HTTP 400 - if syntax error in JSON or JSON missing

•	HTTP 400 - if BOM record can't be found for the given build record ID

•	HTTP 400 - if BOM record is locked

•	HTTP 500 - if a server error occurs

•	HTTP 200 - if the record was added successfully

requests.name: BuildDependencyGraph
requests.description: Purpose: This returns the JSON used to generate the build dependency graph on the client.
